title: 108_s864
content: The "National Guard and Reserves Child Care Relief Act" authorizes appropriations of $10,000,000 for child care for certain military dependents for fiscal years 2004 through 2008. Child Care Assistance for Military Dependents is added to the Child Care and Development Block Grant Act of 1990. The Secretary will provide grants to help eligible persons pay for child care services for dependents by eligible providers. A dependent is defined as an individual meeting specific criteria. The term 'eligible person' refers to a parent of dependents of a member of the Armed Forces on active duty, as defined by specific criteria. The term 'eligible person' refers to a parent of dependents of a member of the Armed Forces on active duty for more than 30 days in support of a military operation. The term 'eligible person' refers to a parent of dependents of a member of the Armed Forces on active duty for more than 30 days in support of a military operation, who has the primary responsibility for the care of the dependents and resides permanently at a location at least 50. The term 'eligible person' is a parent of dependents of a member of the Armed Forces on active duty involved in a military operation, with primary responsibility for their care, residing at least 50 miles from the nearest military installation with child care facilities. The term 'eligible person' is a parent of dependents of a member of the Armed Forces on active duty involved in a military operation, residing at least 50 miles from the nearest military installation with child care facilities or programs funded by the Department of Defense. The term 'eligible person' refers to a parent of dependents of a member of the Armed Forces on active duty involved in specific military operations, residing at least 50 miles from the nearest child development center or family child care home funded by the Department of Defense. Military operations include Operation Enduring Freedom, Operation Iraqi Freedom, Operation Noble Eagle, or any successor operation. To be eligible for a grant under this section, a person must submit an application to the Secretary with required information, including details about the eligible child care. Military operations covered are Operation Enduring Freedom, Operation Iraqi Freedom, Operation Noble Eagle, or any successor operation. To be eligible for a grant under this section, an application must be submitted to the Secretary with required information, including details about the eligible child care provider. Provisions of this subchapter, other than section 658P, do not apply to assistance provided under this section. SEC. 4. CONFORMING AMENDMENTS. Amends Section 658O of the Child Care and Development Block Grant Act of 1990 regarding appropriations under different sections.
